job.description:
Job Description

This position has overall responsibility for all Engineering functions in support of Company?s Wiring Device-Kellems, Bryant and Premise brands serving the industrial, commercial, and residential and datacom markets.? This includes administration and management of the various departments and staff to ensure effectiveness in meeting the overall business goals and objectives set as a strategy for Wiring Device-Kellems, Bryant and Premise brands.

This position works closely with other functional leaders in the company, including those in operations, marketing, sales, and finance.

Duties and Responsibilities
  • Provide leadership through high level participation with WBP functions of Marketing, Operations, Sales and HR to ensure collaboration and strong working relationships.
  • Provide strategic business planning functions including support for new product development strategies which emphasize growth and profit as well as expense and capital budget plans.
  • Ensure resources are in place to meet company strategic goals.
  • Ability to build and develop a strong engineering team.?
  • Provide guidance for staff development.
  • Provide engineering input? at high levels of the organization.
  • Represent engineering interests to external groups and organizations.
Skills and Experience
  • 10 years working experience within engineering plus 10 additional years at management levels within engineering.
  • Knowledge in strategic planning, engineering technology, engineering research, and product development.
  • Understanding of business practices, business management and related support functions.
Education
  • Bachelors Degree in Engineering General
  • Masters Degree in Engineering Management

Job Description

Ref ID: 03017836

Classification: VP/Director of Finance

Compensation: $130,000.00 to $160,000.00 per year

Rapidly growing company seeks a strong Director of FP A for an immediate opening. In this role, you will be responsible for financial planning and analysis (FP A), budgeting, variance analysis, financial modeling, and more. We are looking for a Director of FP A who has excellent analytical skills and enjoys working in a challenging and fast paced environment to support the company's continued growth and success. Role Responsibilities
  • Create and maintain financial models including pricing, cash flows, pro-formas, trends and more
  • Various ad hoc and operational reporting to provide actionable insight to the management team
  • Provide analysis on financial results (trends, performance metrics, benchmarks)
  • Participate in various department-wide initiatives
  • Ad-hoc projects as necessary Qualifications
  • MBA or CPA required
  • 10+ years of analyst experience
  • Strong Excel skills required
  • Ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment
  • Strong organizational, written and verbal communication skills required
  • Ability and willingness to meet business critical deadlines
  • Detail oriented, ability to multi-task and work independently For immediate consideration please contact directly Dirk Kuenzler at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] or call at or fax to . *** For candidates currently living outside of the Triangle, please include a brief cover letter detailing your relocation plans. Thank you in advance. ***

Job Description

Ref ID: 00990249

Classification: VP/Director of Finance

Compensation: $100,000.00 to $150,000.00 per year

Essential Duties and Responsibilities ? Primary responsibility is to prepare financial statements and supporting schedules according to monthly close schedule. ? Prepare and post monthly journal entries of all types. ? Facilitate and complete monthly close procedures. ? Analyze revenues and expenses to ensure they are recorded appropriately on a monthly basis. ? Prepare monthly account reconciliations. ? Prepare departmental P Ls on a monthly basis and report on variances. ? Assist with financial and tax audits. ? Prepare royalty and commission reports. ? Perform other assigned projects and functions as directed by management. Minimum Qualifications ? Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance, or equivalent combination of education and experience. ? Minimum seven years? experience with increasing responsibility within the accounting field required, preferably with a manufacturing background. ? Strong understanding of accounting theory. ? Experience at publicly held companies a plus. ? Progressive experience and knowledge of financial reporting required. ? Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational, multi-tasking, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills. ? Proficiency with Outlook; proficiency in Excel is absolutely necessary. ? Experience with AS400 MAPICS a plus. Ability to independently organize and prioritize workload within a fast paced environment to meet deadlines.Motivated, self-starter, organized, and effective communicator. Please contact your Robert Half Recruiting Manager if interested in this role and if you do not have one please contact me at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]

AC2019

Overview

Every day at Perspecta, we enable hundreds of thousands of people to take on our nation’s most important work. We’re a company founded on a diverse set of capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselves—to respond, to adapt, to go further. To look ahead to the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our customers.

Perspecta works with U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many ways—not only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.

Perspecta’s talented and robust workforce—14,000 strong—stands ready to welcome you to the team. Let’s make an impact together.

Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

Perspecta is searching for a Vice President of Defense Agencies to direct and drive business results for programs supporting Department of Defense Shared Services (I.e. DMDC, DLA, etc.). This includes developing, reviewing, updating, and implementing strategic business plans; understanding the business concerns and issues faced by DoD; and building and delivering business solutions that delight the customer. The Vice President will oversee a management team tasked with delivering those solutions on time and within budget while working to find areas of growth and new business. The Vice President will be expected to have frequent interaction with the customer as well as delivering progress and financial reports to the senior leadership of Perspecta.

Qualifications

To be considered for this role, candidates must have 15+ years of experience in federal government contracting environments with at least 10 of those years in roles of increasing managerial responsibility. A strong business acumen with profit and loss responsibility is essential, as is demonstrated strategic thinking that moves an organization forward in terms of financial growth and customer reach. Candidates must demonstrate their ability to analyze and solve complex business issues and must have experience in budgetary planning and implementation including financial reporting oversight. Candidates must also have demonstrated success in holding their teams accountable for outstanding performance as well as in recruiting and retaining top talent. All candidates will have strong communication skills and executive presence. The position focuses on DoD organizations that support all of the services with the exception of DISA. Leading this broad set of agencies will require the ability to build new relationships, but previous experience and relationships with Defense Manpower Data Center (DMDC) is preferred. All candidates must have a bachelor's degree in an engineering or technical subject or equivalent work experience. The best candidates will have their MBA. **A TS/SCI security clearance is highly desired.

Options

AC2019

Overview Employer is an ultra-high-touch bank that provides extraordinary client service. We believe that one-on-one interactions build lasting relationships. We move quickly to serve our clients' needs so that their financial transactions are handled with ease and efficiency. Client trust and security are paramount in our line of business. Ultimately, our goal is unsurpassed client satisfaction which will lead to personal referrals – our number one source of new business. The VP, Corporate Digital Banking will be responsible for delivery and support of Employer Bank's Digital Corporate Cash Management offering. This role is focused on the conception, delivery, maintenance, and on-going innovation of the bank's Corporate Digital Banking offering. This individual will directly lead the Corporate Digital Banking Product Teams and have dotted-line responsibility for a group of talented Scrum-masters and Business Analysts. This is both a strategic and "hands-on" execution role which will require working closely with many teams across Employer and its vendor partners, and across levels of seniority from the C-level suite on down. This role reports directly to the VP, Digital Banking within the Digital Channels team. Responsibilities Duties and Responsibilities * Drive development of the bank's Corporate Cash Digital Banking experience. The successful candidate will develop a deep understanding of Employer Private and Business Banking Clients, including their use of online and mobile banking channels by actively engaging with clients and the Employer client-facing teams on a consistent basis (relationship managers, business bankers, preferred bankers, wealth managers, etc.). * Work alongside senior management and key stakeholders to define the road-map for the Corporate Digital Banking offerings and champion to key partners throughout the bank. * Monitor competitive trends, evaluate relative product positioning, benchmark Bank relative to key competitors, and target areas for differentiation. Maintain a strong understanding of available Corporate Cash Management marketplace capabilities and the competitive landscape for FRB. Provide timely and strategic points of view to FRB executives around emerging digital offerings and solutions for Corporate Cash Management. * Produce and present product-related management reports on an ongoing basis as required, and ensure adherence to the governance requirements of Employer's Project Management Office. * Work closely with Digital Channels teams (UX, Analytics and Engagement, Consumer Digital Banking, etc.) and key internal business partners including Marketing, Deposit Services, Information Services and Risk Management teams to manage the cross-channel client experience within the Digital Channels properties. * Optimize the services of our partnered vendors by effectively managing the relationships and their deliverables. * Working in a hands-on way, successfully manage and deliver large and complex projects. Provide leadership on major initiatives, including vendor solution contracts, implementations and integrations, new product development, etc. * Define and analyze metrics that provide insight into usage and client experience associated with products and features under management. Utilize these metrics effectively for key product decisions. * Responsibilities include the following: 1) adhering to and complying with the applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-money laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, US PATRIOT Act, etc.) 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completing required training, 4) identifying and reporting suspicious activity to the AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank. Qualifications Skills, Knowledge and Abilities * Deep experience with Corporate Cash Management space and digital offerings (10+ Years) * Strong functional knowledge of Corporate Cash Management Products and Features including * Wires * ACH Payments * Positive Pay * Authorization / Entitlements * Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships and work across multiple internal stakeholders, business areas, and external providers to develop a strategy, road-map and deliver high quality solutions (Full Lifecycle ownership from ideation through to implementation and support.) * Demonstrated expertise in software implementation, in both a software development as well as a SaaS context (integration of vendor solutions) * Track record delivering projects using Agile/Scrum in a highly-regulated environment and, ideally, experience implementing Agile in a legacy waterfall environment. * Strong experience working with IT Partners as well as Risk Management partners (OpRisk, Compliance, BSA/AML, Fraud Prevention, Information Security) on new digital products that may or may not have ever been released to the market. * A strong team player and leader (Planning, Communications, and Managerial Skills) * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including ability to deliver presentations and coordinate across the firm Experience soliciting, gathering, analyzing, user input and requirements. * Provides extraordinary service. Education * Undergraduate degree required (Masters preferred, not required). Physical Requirements * Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens. * Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person. * Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions. * Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. * Must be able to travel in a limited capacity.

AC2019

Job Description

Transport Topics ranked Company #1 out of the top 50 logistics companies in North America, and Forbes named us one of America?s best employers. At Company, our successful sales professionals love the thrill of the hunt and closing the deal. As the Vice President of Business Development, you will ensure our core business is maintained while continuing to uncover and secure new business in this regional position. You?ve built an impressive career already and you?re ready to take your career to the next level. Become a part of our rapidly growing dynamic team and we'll help you develop to a level that will exceed your expectations.
Pay, benefits and more.
We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.
What you?ll do on a typical day:
  • Develop and implement new sales strategies across the organization
  • Serve as a key member of the senior management team
  • Drive value-creating insights, recommendations and solutions across multiple projects
  • Communicate with senior executives to develop and implement selected courses of action
  • Diversify and grow the revenue base and ensure viable options are in place for the long term
What you need to succeed at XPO:
At a minimum, you?ll need:
  • Bachelor?s degree in Business or Management
  • 10 years of business development or sales experience
  • Demonstrated executive-level sales leadership experience
  • Success in selling 3PL transportation services to manufacturers in the industrial, automotive, technology, chemical and consumer packaged goods industries in the U.S.
  • Ability to manage a sales pipeline of prospects and multiple business development proposals
It?d be great if you also have:
  • MBA
  • Availability to travel up to 50% of the time
  • Strong time and project management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize workloads
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to present clean, organized and thorough information and data appropriate for intended audience

AC2019

Job Description

This position will act as an ?Account Lead? for Company, fully leveraging and transforming available resources to educate clients about the Hispanic market and help them come to market and target the Hispanic consumer in the United States. While a sales position, the role is consultative in nature and requires regular interaction and dialogue with Senior level client decision-makers to accomplish Company Inc.?s mission.

Responsibilities:
  • Sale of all Company Inc. platforms including Network TV, Local/spot TV, Network/Local Radio, and all Spanish language and English language digital assets
  • Assessment of top customer objections, industry myths and existing paradigms that are preventing potential clients from investing in the Hispanic space. Help in creation of compelling business case to use across categories/clients that are not active in this area.
  • In-depth knowledge of client?s business and competitive categories
  • Full review and in-depth understanding of available in-house and syndicated research, industry and market trends, as well as Company viewer, ratings and across-platform business data to activate clients on air.
  • Sale and implementation of creative and promotional concepts that will activate client in Hispanic space
  • Work with Research team to create, train and implement consistent ROI and ?size of the prize? opportunity assessment for new and existing clients.
  • Work in-depth with divisional sales team to build media plan solutions to drive consumer sales for brands.? Also, work with agency partners as needed to bring clients to market.
  • Work closely in collaboration with Chicago Network, Spot, Digital and Local Sales teams
  • Coverage of key core accounts and new business targets in the Midwest region
Required Skills & Experience:
  • Bachelor?s Degree required or a minimum of 8 years of Sales experience working with advertising agencies/media buying services and process involved in bringing clients to market across multiple media
  • Must bring unique strengths in the areas of strategic thinking, analytical capability coupled with business strategy
  • Extensive sales experience and relationships working directly with high level decision makers such as CMO?s, SVP?s and VP?s of Marketing, Brand Managers
  • Sales experience working with advertising agencies/media buying services and process involved in bringing clients to market across multiple media
  • Must bring exceptional collaboration and teamwork skills
  • Proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Desired Skills & Experience:
  • Experience/comfort with consumer research
  • Comfortable in working horizontally across different categories, clients, internal teams
  • Experience working directly with client brand teams in Insurance, Financial and Retail categories, beverage, confection, beer, consumer electronics,?healthcare, restaurant, wireless, among others
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong presentation and client engagement skills
  • Strong thinker who can transform copious data into knowledge
  • Must be able to work independently
  • Interest and passion in training others and building knowledge across the organization
  • Well organized, disciplined and detail oriented

AC2019

Job Description

As a VP of BD at Company, you will lead a team of Business Development Executives as they evaluate partnerships and acquisitions in order to continue the growth of the company. As a team leader, you must be clear about the results you expect and devise strategy to achieve them by providing the necessary guidance to other members of the team. You must be able to establish the scope and needs of a given business development project- including establishing the resources required in terms of manpower and finances, estimating timelines for completion, and handling challenges. You must be able to communicate these details to other team members to streamline operations. To be successful in this position, you must have outstanding business acumen, excellent analytical abilities, superior written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to identify trends and make compelling business arguments.
Responsibilities?
  • Recruit and train people who can bring innovation to business development projects
  • Create an atmosphere for the team that allows team members to brainstorm ideas and develop new concepts?
  • Ensure realistic attainment of project goals and objectives
  • Set revenue goals and enact marketing strategies that enhance product sales
  • Establish strong relationships with customers by coordinating efforts between them and your team members
  • Devise metrics to gauge both customer satisfaction and team members? success
  • Ability to report project outlines to senior management?
  • Research market data and utilize internal & external tools to provide meaningful, accurate, and informative data analysis for business development efforts
  • Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of Company?s capabilities and services as well as the existing and future needs of the customer to create high-value proposals focused on delivering the desired outcomes
  • Conduct research to identify new leads and potential markets
  • Identify gaps in existing processes and procedures and effectively recommend and drive improvements?
  • Maintain an active pipeline of forecast sales and accurate, detailed reporting
  • Achieve quarterly and annual revenue targets?
  • Effectively pitch Company?s products and services?
  • Build strong, lasting relationships with clients and further Company?s internal solution business by understanding their needs and business objectives
  • Identify and develop relationships with key decision makers in prospect organizations
  • Attend conferences, meetings, and industry events
Qualifications
  • 5+ years of enterprise level sales experience
  • Demonstrated presentation, reporting, and CRM skills
  • Stellar written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with senior executives and maintain good business relationships with both internal and external clients & resources
  • Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/opportunities and recommending an approach to solutions
  • Ability to work successfully in a team environment?
  • Creative problem-solving ability
  • Digital marketing experience preferred
  • Data analysis experience preferred?
  • Strong technical knowledge and IT fluency
  • In-depth knowledge of the industry and its current events
  • Skill in prioritizing and triaging obligations

AC2019

Job Description

Summary Overview:?The business development position is responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive business development and marketing plan that would increase revenues and profits across the North American market. This position is expected to uphold the values established by the organization, and support and drive strategic growth initiatives.? ? ?
Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions
Implements the recommendations of the strategic business development and marketing plan and monitors external and internal environment for development of new market segments.
Responsible for establishing and maintaining new client relationships
Works collaboratively with Account Development team to ensure continuity and a seamless handover process for new clients.
Provides regular reports to communicate status of new opportunities, competitive analysis and market trends.?Elicits and responds to RFP?s and RFI?s
Develops marketing campaigns for new products and services. This includes formulating a specific budget and expenditure plan for each.
Attends national industry conferences, promotes the services of the organization and develops leads by following up with prospects and coordinating prospective client meetings and visits
Promotes the organization?s services through desired mediums of social media, website, and marketing material
Develops annual sales plan in support of organization strategy and objectives.
Qualifications:
10 + years of successful/demonstrated BPO sales experience in North America (call center, fulfillment, etc)
Demonstrated ability to source new blocks of insurance that have resulted in a transfer or takeover
Have knowledge, including personal contacts with (CFO?s, CEO?S), about life insurance companies and reinsurers.
Bachelor?s degree or equivalent client account or new business development experience
Familiar with a variety of outsourcing of insurance and financial services concepts, practices, and procedures
Proven track record of a superior level of personal business development and business development leadership for minimum of 5 years.
Creative ? ability and background in using imagination, creativity and original ideas
Persuasive and enterprising
Handles rejection well, but does not expect it or accept it as a norm
Experience and a level of success in developing business client prospects from webex presentations, and internet marketing efforts with excellent PC skills
Experience with utilizing effective consumer marketing and sales programs via the internet, social media and other technical approaches.
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong negotiation, presentation, interpersonal and problem solving skills
The ability to work at the strategic level with a client
Strong leadership, organizational skills
Brings a sense of urgency to all endeavors, even impatience at times
A high degree of comfort working with internal and external senior management

AC2019

Job Description

The VP of F&B Business Development is responsible for identifying and evaluating potential food and beverage development opportunities in both domestic and international strategic markets. They will support the long-term portfolio strategy by researching new product trends and potential operating partnerships. All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and Company Resorts international policies, practices, and procedures.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Identify and evaluate potential food and beverage development opportunities in both domestic and international strategic markets; Travels to visit/view sites and determine potential suitability of a concept and understand key issues such as access and operational effectiveness.
  • Enhance company portfolio by identifying, securing, and managing third party partner relationships for development.
  • Leads the research and recommendations for evaluation, development and implementation of new products, services, technology and processes to ensure the Company?s competitive advantage.
  • Creates progressive and profitable food, beverage and entertainment concepts appropriate to the different brands and their upper/upscale market place/location.
  • Assess size of markets using standard ?trip/propensity/spend? methodologies and perform market share analysis.
  • Perform other job-related duties as requested.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Bachelor?s degree in real estate, other related, field , or equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience
  • At least ten (10) years of hotel business development or related experience
  • Intermediate to advanced level computer skills including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
  • Significant experience with an international luxury hotel company, including project/hotel development
  • In depth knowledge of feasibility models; and process for RFQ, RFP, etc.
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Ability to work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays
PREFERRED:
  • MBA or Master?s degree
  • Previous experience in developing luxury hotels and/or independent restaurants in international locations
  • Previous experience working in a similar resort setting

AC2019

Job Description

The world's leading private security organization, COMPANY, has an immediate job opportunity for a Vice President, Business Development. As a Vice President, Business Development, you will be responsible for increasing business opportunities and driving sales to major multinationals in North America and abroad.? The Vice President, Business Development will proactively target major national companies (Fortune 500) to consultatively sell the broadest range of COMPANY services to the client, including risk-based and technology models.
This role will focus on high level consultative and relationship sales.? He/She will be responsible for working with customers to develop integrated security solutions that leverage all COMPANY service lines and provide customers with security solutions that mitigate security threats, balance security risk and seek to reduce their total cost of security ownership.? While working within Secure Solutions USA, the Vice President, Business Development will work with all sales teams in North America to bring in subject matter expertise as needed and will proactively drive targeted opportunities at the highest level.? The successful candidate will be targeted to generate c. $25m+ ACV annually.
COMPANY is a security provider for the United States government, fortune 500 companies, nuclear power plants, oil and gas companies, airport, ports, banks, hospitals, factories, warehouses, commercial facilities, residential communities and much more.
Specific Duties and Essential Functions
  • Gain c. $25m all-commodity volume in new sales Year on Year.
  • Develop comprehensive targeting strategy for F500 companies and work with other sales teams to prioritize targets, especially those with integrated security opportunities.
  • Build a realistic pipeline of opportunities to better guarantee achievement of targets and maintain an accurate sales forecast
  • Maintain full opportunity management process (COMPANY Way) in Salesforce and report monthly on sales performance
  • Build a collaborative working relationship with sales leaders/sales teams across the region and internationally
  • Able to develop and write bid strategy documentation and customer contract approvals to support internal approval processes for large/complex deals
  • Support bid preparation activities, such as Executive Summaries, technical responses, etc.
The Ideal Candidate
Education, Licenses and Certifications Required
  • Must possess one or more of the following:
    • Bachelor's degree in a relevant subject (business, marketing or criminal justice)
    • High school diploma or equivalent with a minimum of five years of high performance sales experience
Type and Length of Specific Experience Required
  • A minimum of five years of solution selling at senior levels within Fortune 500
  • Work history must include demonstration of each of the following:
    • Solid track record of meeting or exceeding sales goals year over year
    • Experience with Salesforce or other customer relationship management application
    • Collaborative/team player experience to deliver results
    • Excellent relationship building and consultative selling skills
    • Outstanding listening skills and ability to think on their feet
Skills Required
  • Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Active listening skills
  • Ability to assess and evaluate situations effectively
  • Ability to identify critical issues quickly and accurately
  • Attention to detail

AC2019

Job Description

Responsibilities:
  • Planning, organizing, coordinating and directing all hospital functions related to growth and business development initiatives
  • Community involvement in order to meet the stated mission, vision and values of HCA Houston Healthcare Tomball
  • Effectively operate departments, continue the improvement of the departments? processes and outcomes?
  • Comply with hospital and corporate policy and procedures
  • Efficiently manage finances and resources
  • Promote teamwork and customer satisfaction
  • Integrate the departments? services into the organization's overall plan for the delivery of care and service
Qualifications
  • Master's degree in Healthcare and/or Business Administration preferred

  • Computer skills required

AC2019

Job Description

At Company we empower individuals and organizations to dream big and achieve more through innovative digital product development and training. ?We do this through our signature immersive bootcamps, our quality online trainings, our elite consulting capabilities and our best selling Company Guides. ?
We work with start-ups and several of the Fortune 500 - ?building products, training engineers and writing the best selling guides for mobile development. ?How do we do it It?s all our people -- we only hire the best. We are a community of Nerds who are Brilliant and Curious, Hard-working and Accountable, Kind and Authentic. ?We are seeking a dynamic sales leader to join the team who will be an integral contributor to our growth and success.
Sound appealing Learn more about us.
As a VP of Business Development, you will...
  • Direct, support, and coordinate all business development activities for a current team of 6. ?Team is expected to grow by 2-3 over the next 12 months.
  • Engage in solution-centered conversations with decision makers to discover their particular needs and goals and communicate that effectively to internal teams.
  • Foster relationships with major players in our industry to leverage their reach into our potential key-client base.
  • Set and secure meetings with target executives to evangelize the brand and set up introductions for BDMs.
  • Ensure that BNR is building on-going business relationships with clients and prospects by collaborating closely with sales and operations teams.
  • Lead regular strategic assessments of existing and potential sales with top accounts, channels and products.
  • Work closely with Marketing and Operations to develop an executable sales strategy that increases revenue across all service lines year over year.
  • Build and manage sales team by setting specific, measurable strategies for the sales team that are inline with the overall company strategy and guiding them to success.
  • Manage pipeline and develop accurate forecasting of sales and timeline.
  • Participate in tech sales process with designers, sales engineer and development engineers, ensuring client goals are met and projects are set up for success.
  • Define and oversee the improvement of sales operational tools, playbooks, guides, and processes.
  • Expect to spend " of time supporting team and " time on direct client management with top accounts.
As a candidate, you...
  • Have 7-10 years of proven sales experience, preferably in technology, serving enterprise level clients.
  • Must have experience selling complex professional services.
  • Enjoy building a dynamic team and mentoring sales professionals toward success.
  • Have 5 years experience directly managing a team of sales professionals. ?Must possess strong leadership skills with a combination of customer-first thinking and metrics-oriented actions.
  • Are comfortable with occasional travel when needed.
  • Are interested in working in our Atlanta office, this is not a remote position.

Job Description

About the Position:

Responsible for sales growth as measured by sales targets. Ownership from new business prospecting, pre-call planning, face to face client meetings, and solution development through a signed SOW. Responsible for developing new sales opportunities within pharmaceutical, biotech and device companies, AOR?s, pharma/life sciences consulting firms, alliance partner organizations as well as other healthcare clients.?

Essential Functions:
  • Meet/exceed assigned sales quota?through?Identification and prioritization of key client targets based on strategic goals and objectives
  • Recognize/anticipate brand needs that fit with VMS core capabilities;?Research and understand client needs, product offerings, competitive threats and most significant issues/challenges
  • Build robust pipeline of new sales opportunities
  • Meet/exceed leading indicator metrics (targeting, frequency, message delivery, admin objectives)
  • Command a strong understanding of the clients? overall brand marketing plans, therapeutic categories, and marketing objectives
  • Lead development of VMS offering/model to address client needs (collaborate with model design team)
  • Deliver capabilities presentation to appropriate targets
  • Actively manage the sales cycle including prospecting, meetings, proposal development, proposal delivery, and pipeline management
  • Responsible for development and delivery of client proposals including working in conjunction with pricing team to gather key information necessary for pricing
  • Identify product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitive landscape
  • Secure signed contract, work order or master services agreement
Required Education and/or Experience:
  • Bachelor?s degree with minimum 6 years of experience pharmaceutical or device manufacturer, or pharmaceutical sales/agency or marketing services
Required Skills:
  • CRM experience
  • Sales planning experience
  • Experience selling into pharmaceutical, medical device or biotech strongly desired
  • Strong presentation skills; passionate and confident speaker
  • Ability to meet and exceed sales quotas
  • Ability to build and maintain relationships
  • Strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office?

AC2019

If you're looking for the chance to learn, grow, and make a contribution to the community, look at employment opportunities with Full Sail University. You'll find your choice of career opportunities, great benefits, an environment that welcomes and values creativity, and a work experience that is both challenging and rewarding!

The Veteran Student Liaison facilitates the integration of incoming Military-connected students in the Full Sail community by serving as an ambassador and point of contact for the students transition to Winter Park, Florida. The incumbent handles multiple responsibilities, solves complex problems, and is open to constant challenge and change. He/she will develop and maintain positive working relationships with all contacts inside and outside Full Sail University and reports to the Military Relations Manager.

A successful Veteran Student Liaison is a team player with excellent communication, organizational and customer service skills. An ideal candidate is a self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Behave as a Full Sail University ambassador and embrace our unique educational model, while maintaining the highest level of integrity, professionalism, customer service, and compliance.
  • Lead and mentor our Veterans Student Union (VSU) club and officer team. Coordinate and run student activities.
  • Coordinate monthly and annual VSU events as well as provide internal/external resources for monthly briefings
  • Distribute Military Student communication and military portal communication amongst Full Sail Connect members. Develop military-connected student resources and materials.
  • Update and maintain all of Full Sails social and web-based platforms to assist incoming and current military-connected students.
  • Develop, maintain and execute a military-connected transition plan for incoming students. Contribute to the development, coordination and maintenance of an orientation program and integration of military-connected students.
  • Military Student Crisis Management: Maintain awareness of campus and community resources. Respond to student incidents and crisis situations. Help resolve conflicts with roommate and/or other residents. Communicate with Security and Winter Park Police to help address student concerns, provide incident updates, and coordinate safety education programs.
  • Must have ability to work flexible schedule including nights and weekends.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Plan and implement workshops and events to promote military and veteran education.
  • Develop and coordinate processes for responding to questions and concerns from military-connected students related to orientation, registration, military services, and other College services.
  • Assist with tracking and reporting needs for military communications strategy.
  • Track student matriculation and progress and act as a main point of contact for military-connected students within the Full Sail Military Center.
  • Conduct surveys and analysis to identify areas of improvement for student transition to Full Sail University.
  • Research and write proposals under the direction of Military Relations Manager for military-connected education initiatives.
  • Conduct weekly library hours for military student Q&A.
  • Provide student placement data and incident reports.
  • Assist Military Relations and Military Outreach initiatives.

Competencies:

  • Ability to interact with people of different backgrounds and cultures.
  • Ability to work with other departments and all levels of management.
  • Student-success oriented attitude.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize job responsibilities to achieve daily goals.
  • Ability to handle multiple student cases at the same time.
  • Ability to complete work with minimal oversight.
  • Demonstrate accomplishment of tasks and responsibilities in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Always looking for ways to improve existing processes.
  • Capable of thinking outside the box to produce creative solutions.
  • Adaptable

Education and/or Experience:

  • Bachelors degree preferred with 1-3 years of college admissions, enrollment or student services experience.
  • Military Background preferred
  • Must successfully participate in and complete all continuing education/training requirements.

Computer/Equipment Skills:

  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, iLife, iWork, Adobe Creative Suite, Salesforce CRM enterprise software, and various other software as needed.
  • Proficient with various Apple and Windows based hardware.
  • Proficient with various audio/video equipment.

Environmental Factors/Physical Demands:

Work is performed in an office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to have the ability to maintain active employee communication and access, input and retrieve information from the computer system. May be subject to bending, reaching, kneeling, stooping and lifting up to thirty (30) pounds.

Full Sail is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Sail is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Are you ready to be part of a passionate
and hard-working team eager to drive our business forward?
Apply Now and move your career forward with Airgas as a

Vendor Management Inventory Technician in Dundalk, MD!

What you
will do:

The Vendor
Management Inventory Technician delivers and services key vending account
customers and customer cabinets / storerooms relative to inventory of gases,
consumables and safety products. Additionally, this position does basic
troubleshooting and mechanical repairs as needed. This position focuses on
servicing existing accounts throughout an assigned territory.

Your
responsibilities:

· Delivery and replenishment to
customers of various industrial products and vending machine or storeroom
items.

· Performs basic troubleshooting and
repairs mechanical vending systems as needed.

· Reviews manual stock levels of
various inventories at multiple plant departments for reorder

· Maintains dedicated branch
inventory levels for proper replenishment.

· Tracks and turns in delivery
tickets and consignment fill tickets.
· Other duties as assigned.

You
will have:

· High School Diploma or GED Required.

· Must have a valid US driver’s license.

· Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Business,
Welding Technology or Sales preferred.

· Minimum 2 years of experience in product
distribution or inventory management.

· Experience with welding and safety products or
related industrial products a plus.

· Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft Office
applications (Word, Excel, and Outlook).

· Demonstrated knowledge of addition, subtraction,
multiplication, and division.

· Effective verbal and written communication and
presentation skills.

· Self-starter; self-motivated; operates with a sense
of urgency; ability to work independently and under pressure to meet deadlines.
· Ability to operate a forklift.

· Demonstrated planning skills and outstanding
personal relationship skills.

· Demonstrates a clear and effective speaking manner
for the purpose of explaining information to customers and employees.

· Strong problem-solver, with a high level of
attention to detail.

· Comfortable interacting with a wide variety of
people with different personalities and backgrounds within Airgas and outside
the Company.

· Ability to solve practical
problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only
limited standardization exists.
We take care of you:


Airgas offers a full benefits package that includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D, Short Term and
Long Term Disability Insurance, Vacation, Sick, Paid Holidays, 401(k)
Retirement Plan with company match, Tuition Assistance and much more!

Who we are:

Airgas,
an Air Liquide company, is the leading U.S. supplier of industrial, medical and
specialty gases, as well as hardgoods and related products; one of the largest
U.S. suppliers of safety products; and a leading U.S. supplier of ammonia
products and process chemicals.

Dedicated
to improving the performance of its more than one million customers, Airgas
safely and reliably provides products, services and expertise through its more
than 18,000 associates, over 1,100 locations, robust e-Business platform, and
Airgas Total Access® telesales channel. As an Air Liquide company, the world
leader in gases, technology and services for Industry and Health, Airgas offers
customers an unrivaled global footprint and industry-leading technology and
innovations.

Check out what a career at
Airgas can offer you!

What do our Team
Members have to say about being part of the team?

“Great place to work
with great growth potential” - Director, Atlanta

“Opportunity to
advance and a great safety program” - Driver, Cheshire

“Fun people to work
with and flexible management” - Sales Specialist

Through 50 years of service, Walser Automotive Group has become a pioneer in the automotive industry. Walser's progressive commitment to growth, technology and a differentiated customer experience has changed the car-buying journey. We don't follow, we innovate and lead. Walser operates 25 dealerships and many affiliated businesses throughout Minnesota and Kansas. Walser also leads by example. We volunteer. We donate. Walser Foundation puts 5 percent of its pre-tax profits right back into the communities in which we proudly operate. That's because we live here, too. Walser is a family-owned, family-run business that believes in work-life balance. Walser is committed to delivering an outstanding customer experience every time – that's what drives us. That's the Walser Way. Walser's Core Values * Do The Right Thing – Nothing is worth compromising a relationship * Lead By Example – Be willing to help no matter how difficult the challenge * Display Positive Energy – A good attitude is highly contagious * Be Open Minded – The only thing that is constant is change Job Details * Embody Walser's industry-defining philosophy—no negotiation, one Best Price, and commission-free sales —allowing you to fully focus on helping guests find the inventory and products that fit their needs * Participate in a paid 10-week training program designed to support and guide you to success as a leader on the sales floor * Possess a passion for the product and technology—you don't need to be an automotive expert—but you must be motivated to become an expert in your product through a dedication to research, growth and intellectual curiosity. Use strong decision-making and active listening skills to think progressively about customer needs and service * Provide a peer-to-peer customer driven sales style that builds relationships, and engages and motivates customers in an authentic, transparent experience * Utilize cutting edge technology to streamline and integrate the Walser Sales Method throughout the entire buying process Minimum Requirements * No sales experience necessary * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including written, verbal, and listening skills * High level of detail orientation and accuracy * Technologically proficient. Prior experience using business related applications or systems a plus * Valid Driver's License and driving record up to Walser standards * 4 year degree preferred or comparable education/work experience in a customer focused, competitive, or revenue generating role Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position. I have carefully read and understand the contents of this job description. I understand the responsibilities, requirements and duties expected of me. The Walser Automotive Group reserves the right to revise the functions and duties of the job when necessary. I also understand that this job description does not constitute a contract or alter my status as an at-will-employee.Hireology . Job Description

Job Title: VDC Engineer
City: Miami
State: Florida or any other unanticipated worksites/locations throughout the US
JOB DESCRIPTION:
1.? ? ? Assist in the implementation of the site safety program as required and ensure subcontractor compliance with safety standards and all applicable safety codes and regulations. Lead Safety Orientations and stand - downs (OSHA 30 and CPR
Certified).
2.Assist in the maintenance of contract documents and electronic web-based (Bluebeam, Plangrid, Share Point/Prolog Converge, Dropbox) documents for field operations.
3.Review all work as it is being placed to be sure it is accurate within accepted tolerances.
4.Review contract drawings, specifications and shop drawings to ensure proper coordination and installation.
5.Produce Request for Information when required.
6.Assist in the preparation of project as-builts.
7.Act as liaison with architects, subcontractors, consultants, suppliers, inspectors, other job staff and owners? representatives in resolving issues related to plans and specifications.
8.Review all general contract and subcontract documents, as well as the job estimate.?
9.Make decisions related to contract drawings and subcontract information and ensure that all drawings and specifications properly relate to the estimate; Provide preconstruction services for jobsite.
10.? ? Review submittals and shop drawings.
11.Assess conformity with contract specifications and resolve any conflicts in interpretation.
12.? ?Prepare scope of work documents for trades.
13.Schedule and participate in subcontractor trade coordination meetings, preconstruction meetings and submittal review meetings.
14.Make decisions related to Building Information Model (BIM), included but not limited to, Navisworks, Revit, AutoCAD, Bluebeam, Plangrid, Procore and Sketchup.
15.Work with VDC Coordinators, and VDC Interns, and provide input on performance appraisals.
16.Review 3D models from designers, subcontractors, and others to ensure proper coordination and installation.
17.Establish and implement project-related standards to facilitate team-based communications and file transfers including deadlines for updated models and locations for use in regular BIM Coordination meetings.
18.Provide technical knowledge of the BIM applications used, related systems and network infrastructure, and advise of new technologies.
19.Provide hands-on training for staff and others on use of BIM tools within existing company processes.
20.Provide services to the Sales Department: Produce models, renderings, images, animations etc to support core goals and challenges.
21.? ?Provide services to the Estimating Department: Develop and utilize models developed by others for Quantity Takeoffs and Value Engineering Studies; Develop scope sheets, estimates, review subcontract proposals and produce budgets.
22.Provide services to the Purchasing Department: Produce and utilize models by others for scope visualization, package breakdowns.
23.Provide services to the Operations Departments:? Produce Logistics and safety planning models and related documentation for Authorities Having Jurisdiction, Owner and Neighborhood communication.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENT: Requires a Bachelor?s degree in Civil Engineering and 18 months of
experience in job offered OR 18 months of experience in the Related Occupation.

RELATED OCCUPATION: Field Engineer or any other job title performing the following job duties:
1.Assisting in the implementation of the site safety program as required and ensure subcontractor compliance with safety standards and all applicable safety codes and regulations. Leading Safety Orientations and stand - downs (OSHA 30 and CPR
Certified).
2.Assisting in the maintenance of contract documents and electronic web-based (Bluebeam, Plangrid, Share Point/Prolog Converge, Dropbox) documents for field operations.
3.Reviewing all work as it is being placed to be sure it is accurate within accepted tolerances.
4.Reviewing contract drawings, specifications and shop drawings to ensure proper coordination and installation; Producing Request for Information when required.
5.Assisting in the preparation of project as-builts.
6.Acting as liaison with architects, subcontractors, consultants, suppliers, inspectors, other job staff and owners? representatives in resolving issues related to plans and specifications.
7.Reviewing all general contract and subcontract documents, as well as the job estimate; Making decisions related to contract drawings and subcontract information and ensuring that all drawings and specifications properly relate to the estimate; Providing preconstruction services for jobsite.
8.Reviewing submittals and shop drawings; Assessing conformity with contract specifications and resolving any conflicts in interpretation.
9.Preparing scope of work documents for trades.
10.? ? Scheduling and participating in subcontractor trade coordination meetings, preconstruction meetings and submittal review meetings.

JOB TIME: Full Time

VEVRAA Federal Contractor

AC2019

Job Description

Position Description: The VDC Engineer will manage, evaluate and assess model-based information from design team, trade subcontractors, and others necessary to construct the project as specified by the contract documents. Has supervisory responsibility for VDC Coordinators, and Interns. The VDC Engineer is the individual on the project responsible for building the overall project ?digitally first.

Reports to: VDC Project Manager, Project Engineer, Project Manager or Project Executive

Additionally has ?dotted line? relationship for coordination and support with:

VDC Project Manager or VDC Manager

Essential Duties & Responsibilities*:
  • Overseeing and making decisions related to BIM model information.
  • Resolving issues related to plans and specifications, especially as it relates to the organization, use, management, and BIM model [updation], by interacting with architects, subcontractors, consultants, suppliers, inspectors, other Turner job staff and owner's representatives.
  • Managing coordination models and model-based submittals and shop drawings. Assessing conformance to contract specifications. Resolving any conflicts in interpretation.
  • Scheduling and managing subcontractor 3d virtual trade coordination meetings, preconstruction meetings and submittal review meetings.
  • Overseeing the BIM related close-out process. Preparing final records such as as-built models which may include connections to project data such as operation and maintenance manuals, warranties, and as-built documentation. Producing the turnover model file with associated documents for the Owner if required for the project.
  • Supervising VDC Coordinators, and VDC Interns, including providing input on performance appraisals.
  • Preparing scope of work documents for trades producing and using BIM models.
  • Developing reports including reports/assessments on coordination meeting records, constraint logs, etc.
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree plus a minimum of four years' related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience. Proven written and verbal communication abilities; proficiency with computer applications, including Microsoft Office suite. Utilizes leading-edge technologies such as BIM and Lean. Ability to read, understand and interpret contract documents, drawings, specifications, scopes of work and project schedule. Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills. Should specifically be proficient with BIM based computer applications such as Navisworks Manage, Trimble SketchUp, and Autodesk Revit.
Physical Demands: Performance of the required duties will require physical ability to occasionally climb permanent and temporary stairs, climb ladders, negotiate work areas under construction, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Occasionally requires passenger use of construction personnel hoists. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Performing this job regularly requires use of hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls, sit, talk, hear and stand. Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

Work Environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee works on-site at the construction worksite where the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts; high precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; outside weather conditions and risk of electrical shock. The noise in this work environment is usually moderate to very loud.

*May perform other duties as assigned.
Turner is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer minorities / females / veterans / individuals with disabilities/ sexual orientation / gender identity.

Job Description

Position Description: The VDC Engineer will manage, evaluate and assess model-based information from design team, trade subcontractors, and others necessary to construct the project as specified by the contract documents. Has supervisory responsibility for VDC Coordinators, and Interns. The VDC Engineer is the individual on the project responsible for building the overall project ?digitally first.

Reports to: VDC Project Manager, Project Engineer, Project Manager or Project Executive

Additionally has ?dotted line? relationship for coordination and support with:

VDC Project Manager or VDC Manager

Essential Duties & Responsibilities*:
  • Overseeing and making decisions related to BIM model information.
  • Resolving issues related to plans and specifications, especially as it relates to the organization, use, management, and BIM model [updation], by interacting with architects, subcontractors, consultants, suppliers, inspectors, other Turner job staff and owner's representatives.
  • Managing coordination models and model-based submittals and shop drawings. Assessing conformance to contract specifications. Resolving any conflicts in interpretation.
  • Scheduling and managing subcontractor 3d virtual trade coordination meetings, preconstruction meetings and submittal review meetings.
  • Overseeing the BIM related close-out process. Preparing final records such as as-built models which may include connections to project data such as operation and maintenance manuals, warranties, and as-built documentation. Producing the turnover model file with associated documents for the Owner if required for the project.
  • Supervising VDC Coordinators, and VDC Interns, including providing input on performance appraisals.
  • Preparing scope of work documents for trades producing and using BIM models.
  • Developing reports including reports/assessments on coordination meeting records, constraint logs, etc.
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree plus a minimum of four years' related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience. Proven written and verbal communication abilities; proficiency with computer applications, including Microsoft Office suite. Utilizes leading-edge technologies such as BIM and Lean. Ability to read, understand and interpret contract documents, drawings, specifications, scopes of work and project schedule. Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills. Should specifically be proficient with BIM based computer applications such as Navisworks Manage, Trimble SketchUp, and Autodesk Revit.
Physical Demands: Performance of the required duties will require physical ability to occasionally climb permanent and temporary stairs, climb ladders, negotiate work areas under construction, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Occasionally requires passenger use of construction personnel hoists. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Performing this job regularly requires use of hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls, sit, talk, hear and stand. Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

Work Environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee works on-site at the construction worksite where the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts; high precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; outside weather conditions and risk of electrical shock. The noise in this work environment is usually moderate to very loud.

*May perform other duties as assigned.
Turner is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer minorities / females / veterans / individuals with disabilities/ sexual orientation / gender identity.
VEVRAA Federal Contractor

  • Providing high level of guest services to each guest.
  • Safely moving vehicles to and from the garage upon request.

Vacation Sales Representative

Diamond Resorts is currently seeking Sales Representatives for our Vacation Ownership Properties in the Orlando area! Our Sales Representatives enjoy fantastic compensation, benefits and work/life balance. If you have a passion for Sales and Vacations, call me today!

Diamond Resorts offers Sales Representatives:

  • Paid training and ongoing coaching
  • Attractive compensation plan
  • Benefits package (medical/dental/vision) after only 30 days!
  • 401k with a company match
  • Deeply discounted resort stays
  • Growth opportunities based on performance not time!
  • Monthly and annual Sales Bonuses-Plus daily spiffs!
  • Unmatched culture which includes attending teambuilding events
  • Work/Life balance-Sales Pros often work less than 40 hours a week!
  • No calling or finding your own leads-we bring you qualified clients!

Sales Representative Job Requirements:

  • Strong desire to grow your sales career and learn our process
  • Weekends are mandatory for Sales Reps
  • A valid FL Real Estate License for In-House Sales Reps (will consider unlicensed if experienced)
  • Dedicated work ethic
  • Professional demeanor and appearance
  • Excellent persuasion, closing and listening skills

Vacation Ownership Sales experience is a plus but not required to join our sales team, we will train the right people how to succeed!

AC2019

Job Description

The Utilization Management Nurse 2 utilizes clinical nursing skills to support the coordination, documentation and communication of medical services and/or benefit administration determinations. The Utilization Management Nurse 2 work assignments are varied and frequently require interpretation and independent determination of the appropriate courses of action.

The Utilization Management Nurse 2 uses clinical knowledge, communication skills, and independent critical thinking skills towards interpreting criteria, policies, and procedures to provide the best and most appropriate treatment, care or services for members. Coordinates and communicates with providers, members, or other parties to facilitate optimal care and treatment. Understands department, segment, and organizational strategy and operating objectives, including their linkages to related areas. Makes decisions regarding own work methods, occasionally in ambiguous situations, and requires minimal direction and receives guidance where needed. Follows established guidelines/procedures.

Required Qualifications
  • Active RN license in the state(s) in which the nurse is required to practice
  • Previous experience in utilization management, discharge planning and/or home health or rehab
  • Prior clinical experience preferably in an acute care, post-acute, skilled or rehabilitation clinical setting
  • Must have good typing skills and proficiency using MS Office Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Ability to work independently under general instructions and with a team
  • Must have the ability to provide a high speed DSL or cable modem for a home office (Satellite and Wireless Internet service is NOT allowed for this role). A minimum standard speed for optimal performance of 10x1 (10mbs download x 1mbs upload) is required
Preferred Qualifications
  • Education: BSN or Bachelor?s degree in a related field
  • Health Plan experience
  • Previous Medicare/Medicaid Experience a plus
  • Call center or triage experience
  • Previous experience with Milliman (MCG)
Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Job Description

Waste Management (WM), a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 25 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and waste-based energy production projects. Why Work for Waste Management Competitive Pay Industry leading Health Insurance 401(k) with Company Match Employee Stock Purchase Plan Dental, Vision, Life, Short & Long-Term Disability Insurance Provided Uniforms Employee Discount Programs, Adoption Assistance Program, Legal Services Plan, and more! Ongoing Training and Career Advancement Opportunities An opportunity to work with an empowering workforce I. Job Summary Under direct supervision, assists with basic truck shop cleaning and maintenance-related duties. II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. Carries tools and equipment to and from storage and working areas. Cleans work area, tools, and equipment. Performs other duties as assigned. III. Supervisory Responsibilities No supervisory responsibilities required. IV. Qualifications The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job. A. Education and Experience Education: Not required. Experience: Four years of relevant work experience. B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements None required. C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required None required. V. Work Environment Listed below are key points regarding the physical requirements, and work environment of the job. A reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. Required to use motor coordination with arm, hand, finger, and leg dexterity. Required to exert physical effort in handling objects more than _ pounds frequently. Requires pushing, pulling, bending, twisting and lifting up to _ lbs. Will be exposed to a physical environment, which involves dirt, odors, noise, weather extremes or similar elements most of the workday. Note: The level of physical effort may vary from site to site and in some cases be greater or lesser than documented here. Benefits At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on 401K, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site. If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click "Apply. I understand that applying to this job indicates that I have the legal right to work in the United States. I agree to perform physical duties of this position as outlined in the job with or without reasonable accommodations. I understand that if offered the position, I will be required to pass a drug screen.

AC2019

job.position: Utility Worker/Groundskeeper - 2nd Shift - Full Time - Arnold Palmer Medical Center
job.description:
Utility Worker/Groundskeeper - 2nd Shift - Full Time - Arnold Palmer Medical Center - Arnold Palmer Hospital

Utility Worker - 2nd Shift - Full Time - Arnold Palmer Medical Center

Orlando Health is one of Floridas most comprehensive private, not-for-profit healthcare systems providing access to nearly two million Central Florida residents and has provided care for more than 4,600 international visitors annually. Our physician practices, diagnostic centers, hospitals and advanced medical treatments and procedures, along with our highly qualified team of medical specialists, have distinguished Orlando Health as a healthcare leader. We are one of Central Floridas largest employers with more than 15,000 employees and nearly 3,000 affiliated physicians supporting our philosophy of providing a continuum of care that revolves around patients needs. As a leading healthcare resource, providing world-class medical care as well as training our future healthcare providers, Orlando Health will continue to foster growth and development throughout the region for generations to come. We are looking for talented individuals to be part of our team.

Arnold Palmer Medical Center - APMC:

Arnold Palmer Medical Center, which comprises Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children and Winnie Palmer Hospital for Women & Babies, has achieved Magnet designation, the gold standard for nursings contribution to quality, patient care, safety, research, and service excellence.

Arnold Palmer Hospital is a 158-bed pediatric hospital facility located in Orlando, Florida, United States. The hospital is part of Orlando Health and is supported by the Arnold Palmer Medical Center Foundation. Arnold Palmer Hospital is the first facility in Central Florida to provide emergency care exclusively for pediatrics. The Bert Martins Champions for Children Emergency Department & Trauma Center is part of the areas only Level 1 Trauma Center. Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children provides a full range of services to meet the unique physical, emotional and developmental needs of children.

U.S. News & World Report has ranked Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children in its 2017-2018 Best Childrens Hospitals rankings for the eighth consecutive year.

Winnie Palmer Hospital is part of Arnold Palmer Medical Center, which includes Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children and the Howard Phillips Center for Children & Families, and is the largest facility dedicated to children and women in the United States. Winnie Palmer Hospital for Women & Babies is dedicated exclusively to the unique healthcare needs of women and babies in a caring, family-centered environment. An extraordinary Orlando Health facility, we are home to leading physicians, surgeons and specialists, as well as one of the nations largest and most successful neonatal intensive care units. Our physicians provide specialized care that covers all facets of women's health, from comprehensive gynecological services and minimally invasive surgeries to obstetrics and high-risk pregnancies and births. Winnie Palmer Hospital is proud to have ANCC Magnet Recognition for Nursing Excellence

QUALIFICATIONS:

Arnold Palmer Medical Center seeks a full time Utility Worker that meets the following requirements:

Hours: 5:00 pm - 12:00 am

Education/Training:

Ability to read and recognize similarities and differences between words and between series of numbers. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers.

Must have good working knowledge and be capable of accessing and using all department related computer systems such as but not limited to the Tele-Tracking programs that include Service Response where applicable.

Licensure/Certification:

None.

Experience:

None.

Essential Functions:

  • Operates outside cleaning equipment, such as, but not limited to, pressure washer, leaf blower, Billy Goat and cart washing machine.
  • Wash low level outside windows and clean all door frames.
  • In the Grounds position, perform liter and debris pick up tasks on the grounds of the hospital and/or on designated areas that will leave area clean and litter-free.
