AC2019

Job Description

Position: Technical Solutions Architect

Job Description: Arrow is seeking a highly qualified Solutions Engineer to support our client base in the Americas region.
This role will provide technical expertise in support of pre-sales activities. This person will assist in the discovery, analysis, design, demonstration, and refinement of technology solutions. There is a technical emphasis on hardware capabilities, software requirements and solution integration. May assist in the development of responses to customer requests and proposals as required.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
? Assists the Sales Team to develop and implement specific account penetration strategies, produce account specific product and service and sales enablement plans.
? Leverages knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address and dispel customer objections to Hitachi Vantara solutions and train the account team.
? Establish relationships with the account team, partners and customers in support of sales team objectives and engages and leverages resources, abilities, budgets and personnel as appropriate.
? Executes technical sales calls
? Configures and documents Hitachi Vantara hardware, software, and service solutions to meet customer and sales objectives.
? Completes required presales documentation quickly and accurately.
? Qualifies sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding.
? Performs a support role in Sales and Services leadership meetings.
? Presents and markets the design and value of proposed Hitachi Vantara solution and business case to partners, customers, prospects and Arrow management.
? Possesses detailed product/technology/industry knowledge. Knowledge of job associated software and applications.

SKILLS
? Time management skills.
? Results driven.
? Communication skills.
? Ability to influence others to achieve results.
? Organizational skills.
? Cross-Functional skill.
? Customer focused.

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
? 4 year degree with 5 years of related experience preferred
? Experience with Hitachi Vantara solutions, highly preferred
? Ability to present effectively in front of groups
? Hitachi Vantara or like industry certification desired

Location: Denver (Panorama)

Time Type: Full time
Job Category: Non-Customer Facing/Supplier Facing

AC2019

Job Description

Position: Technical Solutions Architect II

Job Description: Arrow is seeking a highly qualified Solutions Architect to support our client, CDW, based in Chicago, Illinois.
This role will provide onsite technical expertise in support of pre-sales activities aligned to the RSA portfolio with an emphasis on the RSA NetWitness Platform. This person will assist in the discovery, analysis, design, demonstration, and refinement of integrated technology solutions supporting the CDW selling teams.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
? Assists the Arrow Sales team to develop and implement specific account penetration strategies, produce and execute account specific product, services and sales enablement plans.
? Leverages knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address and dispel end customer objections to RSA solutions, and train the CDW account teams to adequate levels of defending selling campaigns.
? Establish relationships with the Arrow account team, CDW selling teams, and end customers in support of sales team objectives. Engages and leverages resources, abilities, budgets and personnel as appropriate to drive selling results.
? Executes technical sales calls and marketing activities as assigned.
? Configures and documents RSA and Services solutions to meet end customer and sales objectives.
? Completes required pre-sales documentation quickly and accurately.
? Qualifies sales opportunities in terms of end customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding.
? Performs a support role in Engineering, Sales, Marketing and Services leadership meetings.
? Presents and markets the design and value of proposed RSA solutions and business case to CDW selling teams, end customers, prospects and Arrow management.
? Possesses detailed product/technology/industry knowledge. Knowledge of job associated software, hardware, and applications.

SKILLS
? Time management skills.
? Results driven.
? Communication skills.
? Ability to influence others to achieve results.
? Organizational skills.
? Cross-Functional skill.
? Customer focused.

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
? 4 year degree with 5 years of related experience preferred.
? Experience with RSA products, specifically RSA NetWitness Platform highly preferred.
? Ability to present effectively in front of groups.
Ability to make and manage digital technical marketing content; Demos, Videos, Podcast, Blogs, etc.
? RSA Certification highly desired.

Location: Chicago

Time Type: Full time
Job Category: Sales

AC2019

Job Description

Job Purpose

To grow the sales of the High Performance Coatings and Foam business and support the sales team and channel partners, Graco is looking for a Field Technical Sales Specialist in Kansas City, Missouri?and surrounding states?(MO, KS, IA, MN, NE, SD, ND, WI, CO, Southern IL)?to perform product demonstrations, start-ups, training and field service for distributors and end users in the region.? This position will travel extensively in the territory, and has a great deal of independence and self-management, with opportunity for career advancement for individuals seeking a role in a sales organization. ?Travel outside of this region may be required from time to time.?

The High Performance Coatings and Foam business unit has product offerings in Protective Coating application equipment, Foam and Polyurea dispensing equipment, Surface Preparation and Vapor Abrasive Blasting equipment, and Mortar/Stucco application equipment.? This position will concentrate most efforts on the Protective Coatings and Surface Prep/Blasting equipment, but will be involved with the entire product spectrum.? For examples of the product lines, please visit the sites below:

Graco is a global leader in the design, development, and manufacturer of highly-engineered systems for numerous industrial and commercial applications.? Graco was proud to be named a Best Place to Work in Manufacturing and Production by Fortune Magazine in 2016 and 2018.

Essential Duties
  • Train customers, distributors and end users in the proper set up, operation and maintenance of HPCF products and equipment.
  • Assist Graco's area sales managers and channel partners by providing product demonstrations and work to close sales by following up with customers from the demonstration through the date of purchase
  • Perform occasional field start-up, support and service work.
  • Attend Demo Days and Trades Shows
  • Support new distributors
  • Handle customer service calls, generally related to field service work.
  • Responsible for being current on new equipment and applicable technology.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor or manager.
Position Requirements

Essential Requirements
  • Experience in any of the related industries which the equipment is used
  • Good communication, presentation, and training skills
  • Must be able to work independently and display sound decision-making and problem solving.
  • Ability to proactively manage a travel schedule maximizing customers exposure in the most effective,? efficient and cost effective manner
  • High level of mechanical aptitude.
  • 2-5 years of experience in a similar position.
  • Valid driver?s license and be able to travel without notice (approximately 75% of the time)
  • Two-year associate degree in a related field (electrical engineering, mechanical maintenance, etc)
Desirable Requirements
  • Four-year degree or equivalent experience
  • In depth experience with Abrasive blasting, Protective Coating application equipment, or Paint spray application equipment
  • Bilingual?English/Spanish
Proven Quality. Leading Technology.? Launch your career with Graco!

Graco offers attractive compensation, benefits, and opportunities for both professional development and career progression. Graco?s comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, stock purchase plan, 401(k) and tuition reimbursement.

Our expectations are high. That's why we are always looking to hire the brightest and the best!

AC2019

Dürr Systems Inc. has an available position of Technical Sales Engineer in Southfield, MI. Although the Technical Sales Engineer will work in Southfield, MI, the Technical Sales Engineer will be required to travel 20% of working time to customer sites in North America as well as to parent company in Germany. Position requires a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Electronic Engineering & 24 months experience as a Sales Engineer. Position also requires: Exp. must include: 1) 24 mos. exp. developing & selling manufacturing execution systems (MES) solutions to automotive original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) for their paint shops & general assembly; & 2) 12 mos. exp. providing technical assistance to customers. Exp. reqs. may be met concurrently during the same time period. Job duties: Under supervision of Sales Director, develop & sell MES to automotive OEMs for their paint shops & general assembly areas. Provide technical assistance to automotive OEMs for their current & future MES. Work with engineering staff to design custom-made solutions for MES. We are an equal opportunity employer & all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, the presence of a medical condition or disability, height, weight, or any other protected status. We maintain a drug-free work place & perform pre-employment drug & alcohol testing. Qualified applicants should send resume & verification of reqs. to Kristy Summers, HR Generalist, Dürr Systems, Inc., 26801 Northwestern Highway, Southfield, MI 48033. Detroit Free Press. Keywords: Sales Engineer, Location: Southfield, MI - 48033

AC2019

Job Description

We are seeking a Technical Recruiter for our client in Pittsburgh, PA.
This opening is due to growth within our clients organization.
Our client is one of the top growing firms within the area, working with multiple big name companies.

Responsibilities:
-Partner with members of TA Staff (Recruiters, Sr. Recruiter, and TA Lead) to understand the business, the strategy and the message delivery to potential candidates
-Leverage and develop a wide variety of creative sources for talent; job boards, social media, job fairs, campus, community groups, technical councils, etc.
-Build a deep pipeline of candidates for specific client requirements.
-Build and maintain a diverse network externally to pull from for talent.
-Qualify candidates through effective behavioral based interviews.

Qualifications:
-Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience.
-1-3 Years of experience in Recruiting (IT/staffing recruiting a plus), Human Resources, and/or Consulting required.
-Excellent sourcing skills using a variety of creative sourcing techniques.
-Strong analytical skills and effective problem-solving skills.
-Experience leveraging social media and personal networks to identify candidates.
-Ability to work in a high pace growth environment.
-Driven for results and high achievement while maintaining a positive, can do attitude.
-Strong self-starter and ability to manage multiple priorities.
-Strong communication and influencing skills.

Qualifications:
-Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience.
-1-3 Years of experience in Recruiting (IT/staffing recruiting a plus), Human Resources, and/or Consulting required.

Job Description

Synerfac Technical Staffing, an established recruiting firm with 14 offices nationwide, is seeking to add a Technical Recruiter to the Langhorne, PA branch.

The Langhorne office of Synerfac is its longest tenured location and has a strong core of business. With a team of experienced staffing professionals in place, they're looking to add a Technical Recruiter to the team, to support growth and expansion opportunities.

This is a great opportunity for recent college graduates looking to begin their career in an exciting, challenging and rewarding field. Candidates with year(s) of professional experience will be considered as well. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

?Aggressively recruit, qualify and market candidates to our clients.
?Cultivate client and candidate relationships.
?Present suitable candidates in the timeframe requested by our clients.
?Qualify technical professionals for skill, proficiency and suitability.
?Speak / meet with clients and present candidates.
?Coordinate and follow through on business details.
?Finalize and start our employees work / assignments at our client, including completion of New Hire paperwork.

?A roll up your sleeves & do what it takes to get it done attitude.
?Bachelor's Degree
?Professional integrity and a competitive spirit.
?Strong communication skills - both written and oral.
